intro: Peperomia gabinetensis, commonly known as the cabinet peperomia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This compact plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm, featuring thick, waxy leaves that are often green with a subtle variegation. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or reddish in color. Peperomia gabinetensis is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its low maintenance requirements and ability to thrive in bright, indirect light.
